article.headline: St. Peter's 69, Long Island U. 59
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. -- Nick Leon scored 21 points as St. Peter's rallied from a nine-point halftime deficit to defeat Long Island 69-59 Wednesday night. Ryan Bacon added 18 points and a game-high 15 rebounds for the Peacocks (1-3). St. Peter's shot just 35 percent in the first half, including 0-for-5 from 3-point range. But the Peacocks exploded for 47 second-half points, hitting 5-of-9 tries from beyond the arc. Wesley Jenkins and Brandon Hall each hit two 3-pointers and Leon had one. Jaytornah Wisseh led Long Island (1-3) with a game-high 25 points.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
